summary: This is an email from a defense attorney to the government regarding upcoming motions in the Epstein case. The attorney discusses two motions: one about cell tower data and another detailing statements to police and cooperating witnesses, asking if the latter should be filed under seal. The email also mentions logistical issues with getting an affidavit signed by the client (Epstein) due to restrictions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the client whose affidavit needs signing; he is incarcerated at MCC. The legal team is acting on his behalf.

events.title: Defense Prepares Motions
events.description: Defense attorneys inform the government they will soon file two motions: one concerning legal arguments about cell tower data, and another detailing statements to police and discussing discovery and cooperating witnesses, which they propose filing under seal.

keyFacts: Defense attorneys were preparing two motions in August 2019: one on cell tower data and another detailing statements to police and cooperating witnesses.
The defense asked the government for its position on filing the motion detailing witness statements under seal to protect sensitive information.

An affidavit for Epstein needed signing, but his legal team faced logistical hurdles as only they had regular notary access and they did not want to witness his signature, planning instead for him to sign at MCC or in open court.
